Bitcoin mining began Jan 8, 2009. Halving eras are 210,000 blocks (~4 years) So why is the 3rd halving not happening in Jan 2021? It's because the hashrate continues relentlessly accelerating; difficulty adjustments help slow down blocks, but they can only do so much. #NumberGoUp

Q: How is the price of bitcoin set? A: Same as any freely traded asset. People place bids to buy at various prices while others set asks to sell at various prices. At the point of intersection, bids match with asks and a trade occurs. The most recent trade is the current price.

Q: "Why would I buy a fraction of a bitcoin when I can buy many ____ coins?" A: Don't fall for the fallacy of unit bias. It's the same value investment either way; do you want to buy #1 or bet on an underdog? Also, 1 bitcoin is comprised of 100,000,000 units...

3/ what gets hated/criticized/feared in bitcoin? The stuff that matters. Developers pushing for forks that impact hodlers. Miner concentration or ASIC backdoors that undermine PoW.

2/ the centralization of, say, oracles, is critically important insofar as you have a whole ecosystem relying on them as a single point of failure. Bitcoin mostly doesn’t touch oracles in any meaningful way today (in a way that would impact the average bitcoiner.)

Because it’s viewed as irrelevant. It’s not a central narrative in the bitcoin bull case, it’s not systemically important to decentralized infrastructure. Who cares if some irrelevant thing is centralized or decentralized? It’s just irrelevant.

2/ here’s the difference - there’s less demand for decentralized *services* for bitcoin “hodlers” because the decentralization purists don’t need or want many services. BTC on a hardware wallet and many call it a day. They don’t need dex’s b/c they don’t want to trade into alts.

Apples to oranges. Liquid and RSK have how much volume compared to defi? How much are they a part of Bitcoin’s pitch? Bitmex is an exchange that lists quite a few coins including eth...and “ripped apart?” Let’s be real. They’re darlings. Liquid gets far less love.
